instruction.value: Administer by direct injection slowly over 1 minute every 3 to 5 minutes as needed. (1 mg = 10 mL)
Administer by continuous infusion, titrate to desired response.

AdditionalNotes.value: Cardiac Arrest. Administer endotracheal until IV/Intraosseous access is established or return of spontaneous circulation. (0.1 mg/mL = 1:10,000. 1 mg/mL = 1:1000.)
Cardiac Arrest. Intracardiac route should only be used during open cardiac massage or when other routes are not available. (0.1 mg/mL = 1:10,000. 1 mg/mL = 1:1000.)
Symptomatic Bradycardia. Usual range is 2 to 10 mcg/minute.
Symptomatic Bradycardia. Usual range is 0.02 to 0.15 mcg/kg/minute.
